content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `find`. It computes median over arbitrary array. Provide an example

```julia
function find_median(arr)
    # Sort the array
    sort!(arr)
    # Compute the median
    if length(arr) % 2 == 0
        return (arr[end÷2] + arr[end-1]) / 2
    else
        return arr[end÷2]
    end
end
```
This function takes an array as input and returns its median. The `sort!` function is used to sort the array in place, and then the `length` function is used to determine whether the length of the array is even or odd. If it's even, the function calculates the mean of the two elements at the middle index of the array. Otherwise, it returns the element at the middle index.
